document_title: Hyperthyroidism: Causes, signs, treatment and prevention
subsection_content:
Hyperthyroidism can cause dangerous complications in pregnant women
People with severe overactive thyroid face countless problems, even life-threatening complications. Complications may include:
Thyroid eye disease: An eye condition that causes double vision, light sensitivity, eye pain, and even vision loss; Heart arrhythmia: Can lead to the formation and development of blood clots, heart failure, other cardiovascular problems...; Thyroid storm: This is a life-threatening emergency; Complications during pregnancy such as high blood pressure during pregnancy, low fetal weight at birth, miscarriage, premature birth; Osteoporosis.
More than 60% of people with thyroid disease are undiagnosed. It's important to listen to your body before symptoms become life-threatening problems.
